Reviews.Title: “No stay at backroom of hotel !!! just front room beside street.”
Reviews.Author: ali h
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel on November2011, In first day we went to one of backroom of hotel,,,it was very small room without any free space it was terrible! but in second day we ask to hotel stuff that replace my room and then, i went to front room beside street on 4th floor,it was better than that!! i want to say : just front room beside street is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel at all”
Reviews.Author: Clamball
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights in October. The rooms were small and dark but I got an outside room so I am guessing the inside rooms were smaller and darker. I would expect a lot higher standard for the price we were paying. The receptionists while not un-helpful were not efficient and took forever to do the smallest task. Travelling for business I need receipts and it should not be so difficult to provide them. The hotel had organised for transfer from Airport to hotel, which was overpriced and double booked and I had to wait for-ever at the airport for him to pick up the other passenger who was not even going to the same hotel. When I complained to reception there was a lot of shrugging. I would not recommend this hotel and I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “could do a lot better”
Reviews.Author: 06D123
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Turkey as part of a group, so had no say in the hotels we were put in. I would not have picked this one based on Trip Advisor reviews - which I have to say were by and large correct. While we were lucky in getting a room designed for wheelchair access - and threfore ok size-wise, others were not so lucky. One person had to move room three times, as the heating wouldn't work in two rooms and the electricity in the other! Our room was ok, but the bathroom, while big, was designed for wheelchair users so this resulted in the mirror being put too low for normal use, so we had to practically kneel to use it - simple solution would be a bigger mirror! Also the shower area had a two-inch drop into it, which was a potential death trap, as it was positioned right where you step to access teh towels. The 'spa' facilities were skimpy to say the least, - the 'gym' was a treadmill and an exercise machine! The pool is tiny. They are overpriced - $10 an hour for a sauna is top whack for a poor facility, especially as it takes at least 10 minutes to warm up. We were warned that the area wasn't very good, but had no problems in that regard - some of the group explored it at night and had no problems. We ate in teh hotel - breakfast very good - dinner ok. We would not have had dinner except for the fact that it was part of the package. Watch out for taxi rip-offs. It generally cost twice as much to get back from the city centre as it did to get there - maybe because the hotel staff would get us taxis to go downtown, while we just picked them up in the street on the way back and generally got the scenic tour home!

Reviews.Title: “Some details missing...”
Reviews.Author: Chaboo
Reviews.Content: I liked Istanbul but next time sure will not go back to this hotel. The room was very small, the sauna and turkish bath too expensive (10 USD per hor/person). On their website there was a promotion offer for free Airport transfer if you stay 5 nights... the staff "do not know anything about it"... So, look around first, there are many more hotels nearby...

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel but noisy!!”
Reviews.Author: wsthame
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights, the rooms were cleaned every day, the staff were welcoming and friendly, the pool and gym were being re-furbished so did not use them,the pool was very small but ok for a dip i suppose, the breakfast was good plenty on offer eg. eggs cheese salami salad cereal bread cakes ect.. the only bad thing was the constant noise from the traffic and passers by..( If you are going to stay here take ear plugs.) The Hotel is a good base for the Trains and Trams to travel around Istanbul,But would not like to walk around the area alone at night.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel Don't Waste Your Time or Money”
Reviews.Author: dcorby5
Reviews.Content: Terrible place to stay I would not recommend this to my enemey! Below is a summary of the hotel. 1. Pool- was very small and dirty 2. Staff- Didn't speak anything but Turkish and was not friendly. The car service that they recommended to the hotel was a rip off. 3. Breakfast- Very minimal, no real hot food 4. Gym- Extremley outdated and small. The staff charges 30 Lire or around $20 a to use th treadmill. What a great deal! 5. Minibar- didn't exist and the fridge was broken 6. Room- outdated, small, dirty and noisy. 7. Bathroom- outdated and really dirty 8. Hotel Location- poor location, ton of street noise, didn't feel like a safe location. 9. Price- well overpriced. 10. Airconditioning- Didn't exist and the hotel claims to have airconditioning. 11. Maidservice- Terrible the room was poorly cleaned 12. Asked for a kniff to cut fruit and they wouldn't even provide it!

Reviews.Title: “Have never stayed in a worse hotel than this”
Reviews.Author: Sayeed_A
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel to my enemies. The hotel is rated 4 star however it shouldnt be even 1. The staff are very unfriendly and do not help. I luckly stayed here for only 1 night from our 9 nights stay with my wife and two daughters both aged under 3 years old. Rooms very small and dirty and staff service was very unfriendly. Hotel would not even provide an empty plate to put baby food into and did not have any services for warming food. Pool is free, but smelly, hence couldnt step inside and all other services i.e. turkesh bath are changed at premium rates. Hotel is said to be near the Grand Bazaar but infact is almost 30 mins walk away. Breakfast is very basic.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay in the Grand Hilarium”
Reviews.Author: carmiz
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 6 nights in this hotel, 4 persons, 2 rooms. Rooms: size was large enough and arranged well. We found that there are 2 types of rooms. Some rooms face an internal narrow space that provided uncomfortable feeling and no air. Other face the street, with look to the Bosporus. We asked and moved to the Bosporus side, which was big and with nice view. If you stay in this hotel, demand only upper floors with windows to the Bosporus! There is some constant noise from the main street at all time. It was OK for us, but maybe a problem to sensitive people. Staff: All was very polite, trying to help and please. Location: Old city, 5 minutes walk to tram station, train station and busses. We never took taxi, just public transportation. There are also lots of places to eat close by, even in late hours. It was cheap, clean and tasty. The hotel has small swimming pool and sauna, but we didn't have time to use that.

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul Experience”
Reviews.Author: rutabega
Reviews.Content: I read reviews about the "Grand Hilarium" only after I had booked our 3 night stay. I hoped that the people who had written reviews about the hotel had exaggerated...... but they hadn't. Our room was very small. The staff (with the exception of one nice young man) was not helpful and did not speak any tongue other than Turkish . I do not expect everyone to speak English. Arabic would have been helpful... we could have managed with that, or French or Spanish or Kurdish! My husband requested another pillow and the hotel staff said that they had none. No one smiled or greeted anyone in the morning. Breakfast was ok. The people who stayed with us in the hotel were great..... suffering through their vacations as we were. I am sure there are better hotels in Istanbul. Stay away from the Grand Hilarium.

Reviews.Title: “horrible experience!”
Reviews.Author: swiss42
Reviews.Content: the most horrible hotel ever!! small dirty rooms' with no air-conditioning or noisy ones...dirty repulsive bathrooms, unpleasnt staff, tiny cold pool, most horrible breakfas, badly located, noisy, windows facing inner corridors, disgusting hote, not a 4 star hotel, rather a 1 star if at all-do not stay there! horrifying experience, utterly disgusting!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: fabinaty
Reviews.Content: Bad service. The hotel look like it lacks maintenance. Bathroom in bad conditions, TV almost not working, electricity problems. Avoid it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hilarium, Istanbul, Turkey”
Reviews.Author: LOOKOWL
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Hilarium, Istanbul, Turkey, 23-27 Nov 05. I agree with majority of the reviews in reference to the rudeness, dimly lit stairwell, lobby, and hallways. The rooms are definitely rather small. The only reason that I rated the hotel a 2 is because the staff seem to go out of their way to be nice the last two days. Personally, I would keep away and highly encourage other travellers to book a reservation elsewhere. It is not worth the aggravation. The bathtub was never cleaned during my entire stay. I WILL NEVER STAY THEIR AGAIN!!!!!

HotelInfo.Address: Fabrika Sokak 3-5 Yenikapi, Istanbul, Turkey
